result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L Nighbor

defendant.name: Nighbor, Christopher L
defendant.address: W6647 County Road YY, Neshkoro, WI 54960

records.addlTxt:
3:35 PM Defendant Christopher L Nighbor appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Christopher L Nighbor.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that a Prelim was recently held, a motion to suppress has been filed today.  Atty Juech has no objection scheduling a motion hearing.

BY THE COURT:  Set Motion Hearing
Motion hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on November 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:24 PM Defendant Christopher L Nighbor appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Christopher L Nighbor.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading. Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher L Nighbor in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Christopher L Nighbor. 
Deputy Jeremy Krueger called and sworn; examined by Atty Burdon.  Defendant identified by Witness. 
Exhibit 1 (Driving Record) marked by Atty Burdon and offered.  Atty Gumz has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit 1 received.

Exhibit 2 (Lab Report) marked by Atty Burdon and offered.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit 2 received

1:16pm  Cross-examined by Atty Gumz
Witness excused

Atty Burdon asks for a bind over and makes arguments.
Atty Gumz makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings. 
set arraignment
Information will need to be filed by the State within 30 days
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher L Nighbor appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Christopher L Nighbor. 
Atty Gumz has an offer that he has not yet been able to speak with his client about; requests a prelim be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license   *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol

10:46 AM Defendant Christopher L Nighbor appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Christopher L Nighbor.  Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  

Atty Juech has no objection to a $1,000 signature bond with conditions. 

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
 *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 

Atty Gumz waives time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
